titles.title: To designate the Federal building and United States courthouse and customhouse located at 515 West First Street in Duluth, Minnesota, as the "Gerald W. Heaney Federal Building and United States Courthouse and Customhouse".

To designate the Federal building and United States courthouse and customhouse located at 515 West First Street in Duluth, Minnesota, as the "Gerald W. Heaney Federal Building and United States Courthouse and Customhouse".

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings and Emergency Management.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote .
Mr. Oberstar moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 187.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Committee Agreed to Seek Consideration Under Suspension of the Rules, by Voice Vote.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

committee.name: House Transportation and Infrastructure
committee.subcommittee: Economic Development, Public Buildings, and Emergency Management

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)
Designates the federal building and U.S. courthouse and customhouse located at 515 West First Street in Duluth, Minnesota, as the "Gerald W. Heaney Federal Building and United States Courthouse and Customhouse."
